org.eclipse.gef4.mvc.fx.policies

Class CursorSupport

  • java.lang.Object
    • org.eclipse.gef4.mvc.fx.policies.CursorSupport

  • public class CursorSupport
extends java.lang.Object
    The CursorSupport provides methods for changing and restoring the mouse cursor. It is designed to be used from within an IPolicy implementation.

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      CursorSupport(IPolicy<javafx.scene.Node> hostPolicy)
      Creates a new CursorSupport that can be used to change and keep track of the mouse cursor for the given IPolicy.

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Instance Methods Concrete Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      javafx.scene.Cursor getOriginalCursor()
      Returns the original mouse Cursor that is stored by this policy.
      boolean isCursorChanged()
      Returns true if the mouse cursor was changed by this policy.
      void restoreCursor()
      Restores the mouse Cursor that was replaced by a previous storeAndReplaceCursor(Cursor) call.
      void setCursor(javafx.scene.Cursor cursor)
      Sets the given Cursor as the mouse cursor for the Scene of the host visual.
      void storeAndReplaceCursor(javafx.scene.Cursor cursor)
      Changes the mouse Cursor to the given value if necessary.

      • Methods inherited from class java.lang.Object

        clone, equals, finalize, getClass, hashCode, notify, notifyAll, toString, wait, wait, wait

    • Constructor Detail

      • CursorSupport

        public CursorSupport(IPolicy<javafx.scene.Node> hostPolicy)
        Creates a new CursorSupport that can be used to change and keep track of the mouse cursor for the given IPolicy.
        Parameters:
        hostPolicy - The policy that is supported.

    • Method Detail

      • getOriginalCursor

        public javafx.scene.Cursor getOriginalCursor()
        Returns the original mouse Cursor that is stored by this policy.
        Returns:
        The original mouse Cursor that is stored by this policy.

      • isCursorChanged

        public boolean isCursorChanged()
        Returns true if the mouse cursor was changed by this policy. Otherwise returns false.
        Returns:
        true if the mouse cursor was changed by this policy, Otherwise false.

      • restoreCursor

        public void restoreCursor()
        Restores the mouse Cursor that was replaced by a previous storeAndReplaceCursor(Cursor) call. If the mouse Cursor has never been replaced, it is not changed.
        See Also:
        storeAndReplaceCursor(Cursor)

      • setCursor

        public void setCursor(javafx.scene.Cursor cursor)
        Sets the given Cursor as the mouse cursor for the Scene of the host visual. Note that this method does not store the original mouse cursor.
        Parameters:
        cursor - The new mouse Cursor.
        See Also:
        storeAndReplaceCursor(Cursor), restoreCursor()

      • storeAndReplaceCursor

        public void storeAndReplaceCursor(javafx.scene.Cursor cursor)
        Changes the mouse Cursor to the given value if necessary. If this method is called for the first time (in general or for the first time after a call to restoreCursor()) the original cursor is stored so that it can later be restored.
        Parameters:
        cursor - The new mouse Cursor.
        See Also:
        restoreCursor()
